author: Doug Bostrom
content:
If you can stand Jeremy Clarkson and his general attitude problems for an hour there’s an otherwise good documentary with a lot of information on Brunel’s Great Britain, subsequent Great Eastern as well as other results from Brunel’s frenetic pace of engineering and building (could turn sound down but Clarkson’s script does include a lot of interesting facts interspersed with Clarkson’s specialty style of nostalgic British jingoism).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QwHnVH9jWmU

Brunel was the equivalent of packing a good half dozen engineer/promoters along the lines of Musk into a single body. Burnt fast but very bright indeed. It’s hard to believe he was dead not so long after the following photo was taken.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Great_Eastern#/media/File:IKBrunelChains.jpg

author: ws
content:
Going across the pond on 1100 tons of coal is like going to the moon..
On paper, they carried enough coal for two trips across the pond..
Good stuff!
